Course Outcomes.CO1: Ability to use various network security tools.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Abilitiy to identify of basic network and system level vulnerabilities and learning techniques/tools to identify them.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Ability to design and implement various network access control and security postures.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Ability to design and implement various security postures using system and network based cryptographic frameworks like OpenSSL.
Course Outcomes.CO5: Ability to design and use various network evasion tools

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Basics of systems and network security, TCP/IP networks, historical security models

Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Assignment – Designing your own rudimentary kernel firewall

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Network access controls - ISP scale blacklists/DNS filtering/DNS injection/middleboxes
Network security assessment tools/engines -- wireshark, tcping, tcptraceroute, iperf, dig, nslookup, nmap, zmap, shodan , censys
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Exercise - Using network reconnaissance tools and services to identify and report vulnerabilities

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Buffer overflow vulnerabilities - stack smashing, R2Libc
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Assignment - basic shell code injection attack

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Offensive tools to exploit remote vulnerabilities - shell code generation and injection injection, password sniffing, cracking etc. using Metasploit
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Exercise - using metaspoilt to design and inject shell code

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: More on offensive tools - threat hunting
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Exercise - using metasbolt for remote server exploitation

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Basics of confidentiality, integrity and authentication paradigms
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Exercise -- OpenSSL framework for file encryption and integrity protection

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: CIA implementations - case study SSL v1/v2/v3 , TLS v1.1/v1.2/v.1.3
CIA implementations - VPNs and tunnelling protocols
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Exercise -- Using openVPN and IKE tools

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: SSL MITM tools -- ssltrip, burp suite, etc.
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Exercise - using various MITM tools and scraping web traffic.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Basics of Network Anonymity - Mix Networks and Onion Routing
Practical Network Anonymity and Privacy - Tor
Weekly Lecture Plan.Assignments: Exercise - Setting up your own private Tor network with configurable parameters

Textbook: The Hacker Playbook 2 and 3: Practical Guide to Penetration Testing. Peter Kim.
Network Security. PRIVATE Communication in a PUBLIC World. Char- lie Kaufman, Radia Perlman and Mike Speciner. PHI Learning Pvt. Ltd
Computer Security. Principles and Practices. William Stallings and Lawrie Brown. Pearson Education
